block_list.title: Video Tutorial
block_list.body: This model is my first request from my viewers ( hopefully subscriber ). A few weeks ago I ask is there something my viewer wants to learn and a flicker or Frisbee was requested. This origami model is a Frisbee, the Penta-Flinger designed by Ed Sullivan. It is made of 5 identical modules. The original origami instructions uses a 2x3 rectangular sheet for the modules. Here I'm folding a 2x3 rectangle from a square instead. The model is really fun to make and easy to throw. I know you are sure to like it. Here is the video timeline so you could jump through the video quickly: 0:00 Introduction 0:07 Flight Demonstration 0:16 Creating a 2x3 rectangle from a square sheet 1:40 Module Folding Instructions 3:16 Penta-Flinger Assembly Here at Heap Art, we are trying to inspire people to connect with each other through origami and paper folding. Subscribe to my channel to receive something new every week. If you like Paper Airplanes and you like Origami. Please subscribe to my channel using the link below: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwVrmDKZhN9C22O8lzHRFCA?sub_confirmation=1

block_list.body:
• Penta-Flinger by Ed Sullivan
  • Un-unfoldable Box by Ed Sullivan
